explanation: The report is not correct as stated. The mhd_assert(NULL != res) is an assertion macro; in builds where assertions are enabled it has observable behaviour (logging/abort) and its removal would change program behaviour, so it is not dead. Even if the expression itself has no side effects, the assertion can alter control flow/timing/diagnostics. MISRA Rule 2.2 forbids executed operations whose removal would not affect behaviour — here removal would affect behaviour in assertion-enabled builds. Only if, for the whole project and every build configuration, mhd_assert is defined as an absolute no-op (no side-effects, never executed) could it be considered dead; that project-specific fact is not provided. Therefore the reported violation is not justified without evidence that the macro is permanently inert in the project.
